title: China introduces tax reductions, exemptions for semiconductors
text:
March 30, 2018 / 7:10 AM / a few seconds ago China introduces tax reductions, exemptions for semiconductors Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BEIJING (Reuters) - Chinaâ€™s finance ministry said on Friday it had updated tax rules for semiconductors, making certain chips tax exempt for a period of five years. 
The new tax rules are effective from January 1, 2018. 
Production lines that involve chip sizes that are less than 65 nanometers and have an investment of over 15 billion yuan ($2.39 billion) will qualify for the exemption. 
Some production lines involving sizes of less than 130 nanometers will also qualify. 
China has promoted an aggressive investment policy for semiconductors and plans to be a global leader in the industry by 2030. Reporting by Cate Cadell; Editing by Himani Sarkar
